1.content: First of all, what is your gender?
1.title: Gender

11.content:
Dragon Slayers were rare, but female Dragon Slayers were even rarer.

You never knew your family; to be honest, you never even knew where you came from. All you remember were bits and pieces of your past until you turned 6. The earliest memory you had was when you were wandering alone in the meadows far away from civilization, lost and scared. Then it happened: all of a sudden, the sun was blocked out and a giant shadow was cast on the ground. You look up and to your amazement, you see the magnificent . . .
11.title: Female

111.content:
Dragons don't normally roam nor do they pick up children, but when Ignis looked down and saw you standing there, lost and terrified, he couldn't just leave. Instead, he flew down and spoke in a roaring voice, "Human, are you lost?"

You nodded shyly.

Ignis stared for a few minutes. Then, to your astonishment, he leaned forward and laid a wing on the ground before you. "Come then. I will take care of you."

And so that was how it started. For the next 5 years, you stayed with Ignis in his home in the Fire Plains, learning how to control fire magic. But this wasn't just any fire magic -- this was the great Ignis' fire magic. He had given you his blood after taking you home with him on the first day, saying with this, you can now not only control fire, but also breathe and eat it as well. At first, everything was confusing, but then it started growing on you. After all, fire dragons were immune to fire, so if you had Ignis' blood, you were as well.
111.title: Ignis, the Fire Dragon

1111.content:
Little did you know your days with Ignis were numbered. Then suddenly one day after waking up, you found yourself back at the meadows you first met him at. You frantically shot up and started looking for him when you felt something on your neckline. Then you realized it was Ignis' goodbye present: a necklace with a flame pendant bearing a ruby in the center. Though you searched for him, you never saw him again.

Since then, you have been continuously traveling around the land of Illyse, looking for jobs to complete.

And in the progress, wondering if you will ever see Ignis ever again.
1111.title: Ignis' Farewell

11111.content:
All around you are trees, trees, and more trees. That's expected of course, since you're in the East Forest after all. A few hours ago, you had picked up a job: find a missing woman that was last seen in the forest you are in right now. Apparently, she had been out to pick up herbs.

You check the time, realizing it's been 4 hours since you started your search. It's starting to get dark and by now, most of nocturnal monsters would have woken up by now. But you can't just abandon your job. What if the woman really is in danger?

Just as you resume your search, the bushes start to rustle; something's about to come through. There's a high chance it's a monster, but if you attack it now, what if it turns out to be someone - or something - not harmful? But then again, if you don't attack, it might turn out to be a wild cougar. You:
11111.title: Job: Find the Woman in the East Forest

111111.content:
It catches the bush on fire and you catch sight of the 2 shadows past it. To your surprise, the top part of the bush suddenly turns into ice. The heat from the fire melts it, causing drops of water to form and extinguish the fire. Then slowly, the rest of the bush freezes until it is nothing more than a chunk of frozen water.

You watch with alertness as the 2 shadows emerge from the trees, revealing a guy and a girl both around your age.

"Who are you?" demands the guy.

"I could ask you the same thing," you reply.

"We don't mean any harm," pipes up the girl. "We were looking for a missing person."

At this, your ears perk up. "You wouldn't happen to be on a job to search for a twenty-five year old woman, would you?"

The pair exchanges glances before turning back to you. "Did you get the same job?" asks the girl.

"I did, and I've been searching for her for five hours. I didn't see anything though. Did you?"

The girl glances at her companion before looking back at you. "If you agree to help us out, we'll tell you. We can split the money three way after we complete the job."
111111.title: Throw a fireball

choices: Suggest luring them away from the fire
Suggest that you eat the fire and then attack
1111111.content:
"Okay, sounds good," you accept. "But how do I know you're not just going to ditch me after we find the woman?"

"How do we know you're not going to attack us after we give you the information?" retorts the guy.

You nod. "I guess you're right. Nothing's more important than a mage's honor, right?" You smile before telling them your name. "And as you can see, I'm a fire mage," you add lightly.

"I'm Ally and I'm a spirit user. That's Erik," introduces the girl. "He's as cold as the magic he uses."

"Hey!" yells the Ice mage, causing you both to laugh. You then think back to what Ally says about her magic.

A spirit user huh? You think to yourself. You've heard of them before. They're wizards that collect special keys that summon other beings such as golems to aid them. That's a pretty neat kind of magic.

"Anyway, back to the missing woman," speaks up Erik. "From what some members in our guild told us, there's been a group of thieves hanging out in the forest and robbing those they come across. There's a chance they may have come across the person we're looking for and decided to capture her. I think our best bet is to find their camp."

For the next 2 hours, you three navigate through the forest. By now, the moon is shining bright in the sky. Just as you are about to ask for a rest break, a faint glow catches your eye from deep within the mass of trees. "Hey, look!" you inform the others. "I think I see a fire. It may be the thieves."

Sure enough, it is. Soon, you all find yourselves hiding behind a large shrub from a group of 6 men. And to both your glee and dismay, the woman you're looking for is located in the center of the men, bound by rope.

"What do you think we should do?" asks Ally.
1111111.title: Agree

choices: Stay and find your own place to be. You don't trust her.
112.content:
A sapphire creature stood tall in front of you, enormous and gallant. Its beautiful cerulean, crystal-like scales reflected the sunlight as the dragon moves closer towards you. It lowers its head until its eyes are only a head above yours - blue and bright. You freeze, unable to move, as the dragon speaks.

"A human child," it says, its voice low and hoarse, "how rare. Do tell me - why are you here?"

You look at the dragon, afraid but enthralled, you wonder if you should escape but the calm look it gives you ease you a little bit. "I... I'm lost."

The dragon lifts its head, still looking at you. "I can find you a way home."

You hesitate, because you cannot recall whether you have a place to return to. "I don't really... have a home."

The dragon stands still, and there is a quiet moment as it scans you with its azure eyes. Perhaps the dragon wonders why you do not have a home, but it doesn't seem to be suspicious of you. It takes a step back and waves its tail which, in a flash, turns into a magnificent mid-air river flowing around you.

"My name is Stagna," it says. "If you don't have a place you belong to, you can come with me."

You contemplate for a little while before...
112.title: Water Dragon

114.content:
There was no doubt it was Ildirim, the Lightning Dragon. You could feel the electricity in the air as the dragon swooped down and landed before you. He observed you carefully before speaking in a thundering voice, "State your name, human."

You replied nervously and watched as the dragon stared at you. "Where are your parents?" he asked.

"I-I don't know who m-my parents are," you stammered.

"I see. Then come." He laid out a wing clad with metallic gold scales. "I will take care of you."

For 5 years, Ildirim took care of you. Though he appeared harsh and strict at first, you realized he really did care. One day, Ildirim approached you. "Come, child," he boomed. "Today will be the day you become a Dragon Slayer."

At that moment, you didn't know what a Dragon Slayer was, but Ildirim explained. "And once you become a Lightning Dragon Slayer, you will be able to learn Lightning Dragon Slayer Magic. With this, you will be able to control lightning and summon thunderclouds and storms. You will also be immune to all lightning attacks and you can recharge quicker on a stormy day."

Once you gained a better understanding about becoming a Lightning Dragon Slayer, Ildirim made you one. Immediately after that, your training began.
114.title: Ildirim, the Lightning Dragon

1141.content:
For 5 years, you trained with your beloved dragon guardian. However, everything ended one morning. Yesterday had been filled with hours and hours of training and control practice so you had decided to sleep in. Once you opened your eyes, you were met with the shining sun. That was strange -- how could the sunlight get through the cave roof? Then it hit you: you weren't in Ildirim's cave at the top of Helios Mountain anymore.

You were in the meadows where you first met the Lightning Dragon.

Frantically getting up, you searched for Ildirim but to no avail. Then you realized something was on your neckline: a silver necklace with a yellow sapphire pendant. Then it hit you: this was your goodbye present from your guardian. Since then, you have been traveling around the land of Illyse in search of both jobs and Ildirim. You haven't had any luck finding him though, but you hope one day, you will both reunite.
1141.title: Ildirim's Farewell

choices: I want to protect the people I love
I want to become one of the best mages in the land
11411.content:
Today is the day you will finally be joining Janus, one of the top guilds in the land of Illyse. This has been your dream for 3 years - besides reuniting with Ildirim of course - and you feel you're finally ready to take on the admission exam.

I wonder what it'll be, you think as you walk down the streets of Magnolia, the town where Janus resides. From what I've heard, less than 20 people are admitted every year. Is the test really that hard?

You turn the corner and immediately stop and gawk. At the end of the street was a tall, gigantic 2-story building made of stone. The entrance bears a sign that reads 'Janus' and past that is are wooden double doors. At the very top of the building is a large bell. This is it.

This is Janus.

With a renewal of spirit, you speed down the street with your backpack and suitcase in hand, excited to finally meet the guildmaster of Janus, Master Caerus.

Finally, you reach the wooden double doors, and with a creak, you open it. To your astonishment, the interior looks even spacier than the exterior. In the middle of the building is what resembles a cafeteria, fill with benches and wooden tables and the guild members who look like they're all having a great time. From the inside, the building is supported by massive wooden beams that are station at each corner of the building.

You take all this in by bits and pieces. Because you are too distracted by the sheer vastness and the liveliness of the place, you don't notice someone approaching you.

"I don't remember you being a member of Janus," comes a smooth, deep voice.

You snap your head to the source of the sound. To your surprise, you see a tall dark-haired teenager a few years older than you. He looks down at you with a stoic expression. "State your purpose," he instructs.

"I want to join Janus," you reply.

The guy blinks twice before his face softens. "Follow me," he says. "I'll take you to our guild master."

It's not like you have a choice, so you follow him as he heads upstairs. A few minutes later, you arrive at the front of Master Caerus' office. The guy knocks firmly and is answered with a 'Come in'. He opens the door, leans inside slightly, and speaks, "Master, we have someone that wishes to join the guild."

Suddenly, the door flings open, barely missing the tall teenager, and reveals an elderly man with a white beard and a purple robe. He looks at you with bright eyes and motions you in. "Come, come! Take a seat!" he exclaims, quite cheerful for someone that could be your grandfather's age. He then looks at the dark-haired male. "Thank you, Xavier. You may go now."

'Xavier' bows his head lightly before leaving the room. You look back at Master Caerus who gazes upon you with a smile.

"So you wish to join!" he bellows. "I'm pleased. However, before you can become a member of our guild, you must answer some questions about yourself and pass our admission test. First question!"

He goes on for 5 minutes, asking you basic questions such as 'What is your name", "How old are you", and "What type of mage are you". Then it comes down to the last question:

"What do you wish to accomplish in your life?"
11411.title: To the Present!

You frantically shot up and started looking for him when you felt something on your wrist. Then you realized it was Ignis' goodbye present: a rope bracelet bearing a claw. Though you searched for him, you never saw him again.

Since then, you have been continuously traveling around the land of Illyse, looking for jobs to complete.

And in the progress, wondering if you will ever see Ignis ever again.
1211.title: Ignis' Farewell

12111.content:
It's 9 AM on a nice Tuesday morning and you find yourself in an arena, surrounded by cheers and shouts. You make out your name from the crowd as well as your partner's.

"Tell me why we're here again," grumbles Evan, your 3-year-long friend.

"Because our rent is due in a week and we need the money," you reply back.

A few days ago, you and Evan had entered a tag-team dueling tournament for mages only. Since Evan was an ice mage and you were a Fire Dragon Slayer, you both - or, well, you- decided to sign up. And now here you both are at the final round for the prize money which could pay for both of your rents for the next 2 months.

You snap out of your thoughts as your opponents walk into the arena. They are 2 tall, muscular men with a slight barbarian look, but if they managed to get to the final round, it must mean they're pretty good. You then exchange glances with Evan. Out of the two of you, one has the smarts and the other has the charm. You're the one with the:
12111.title: Fire Dragon Slayer // To the Present

121111.content:
You analyze your opponents carefully. One of them has bushy eyebrows, so you decide to call him Bushy for now. The other is hairless with a mustache, so you call him Baldy. From what you've heard, you will be going against an Ice wizard and a Wind mage. However, you do not know which one is which.

It then comes down to one question: Should your side attack first, or should you stay back and observe before doing anything else?
121111.title: Evan has the charm.

121112.content:
"So, big brain," you say to your partner. "What's our plan?"

Evan analyzes the men parallel from you both before making a face. "They both don't look very smart but that's from observation only. They're physically strong though, that's obvious. I think we let them attack first to see how they work."

"Alright, we'll wait for them to make the first move."

You and Evan get into position, watching your opponents carefully as the MC starts the countdown. "Fighters, ready! In 3 . . . 2 . . . 1 . . . GO!"

Almost immediately, your opponents -- you nickname one of them Bushy for his eyebrows and the other one Baldy -- spring into action. Bushy claps his hands together before slamming them down onto the ground, causing the surface beneath you to rumble and split into half. Looks like that one is an Earth mage. You avert your attention to Baldy who does a hand symbol before a sword made of ice appears in his hand. Looks like he's an ice mage like Evan.

Glancing between the two, you decide to handle:
121112.title: Evan has the smarts.

1211121.content:
You dodge the split surface beneath you and charge towards the Earth mage. Evan sees this and goes after Baldy, ensuing a massive ice battle between the two. You turn your attention back to your foe who has his palms face outwards. All of a sudden, a huge slab of rock shoots out from the terrain before you, blocking your way and nearly injuring you. You slam your flame-engulfed fist into the solid mass and shatter it to pieces. The crowd goes wild.

"You're a strong little brat," praises your opponent. "But are you as fast?"

The ground beneath you rumbles once more. Then to your dismay, shards of crust expel out from below, covering a third of the arena and unfortunately, blocking your path to reach Bushy. You come down to 2 options: fight from afar or try to get closer. You:
1211121.title: Bushy, the Earth mage

choices: Jabbing him in the nose with a fist full of flames
Blowing a powerful stream of fire from your mouth
1211122.content:
If you let Evan go against Baldy, the match might take longer than normal.

Dodging the giant crack in the ground created by Bushy, you charge towards his partner, creating a flame in your palm as you go. Once you're at a good distance, you throw it at the ice mage who dodges it and encounters by creating a giant icicle and flinging it towards you. You easily melt it, not realizing another icicle had been thrown at you. It grazes your left arm, stinging, but you ignore it and turn your attention back to Baldy.

For the next 5 minutes, you two go back and forth with him creating numerous weapons made of ice and with you countering and attacking with fire. Finally, you see an opening. After he dodges several of your flames, he loses his balance. You take advantage of this by dashing by his side and . . .
1211122.title: Baldy, the Ice wizard

12111221.content:
Relying on your physical strength and flames, you deliver the final blow. Baldy falls back and lands on the ground with a loud 'thud'. The crowd goes crazy and you shoot them all a charismatic smile and wave before remembering your partner. You look back and to your glee, you find Evan leaning over an unconscious Bushy with a grin and a sword in hand.

You have won.

The match is soon followed by the handling of the prize money as well as a mini celebration between you, your partner, and some of your friends at the inn where you and Evan stay. It lasts for a few hours and the next thing you know, it's 4 PM. Seeing there is still daylight, you and Evan decide to stroll around the town for a bit.

"So," says Evan as you guys walk down the streets, taking in the sight of merchants and traders doing their business. "Do you want to go pick up a job or just take it easy for the rest of the day?"
12111221.title: Jabbing him in the nose with a fist full of flames

121112211.content:
"Still feeling the adrenaline from the fight?" jokes Evan.

You both make your way to the local tavern where you are greeted by the bartender. "Are you here for a drink?" she asks nicely.

"No, we're here for a job," you reply by with a smile.

Hearing this, the young lady directs you upstairs before leaving. You and Evan browse the bulletin board that takes up a whole wall, pin with fliers and wanted signs. This is the Request Board where job requests are hung out for locals to look through and choose a job they want to complete. They range from minor jobs such as finding lost animals to major jobs such as capturing criminals that have escaped from prison.

In the end, Evan comes down to 2 possible jobs that both reward 500,000 galleons.

"This one is a search," says your friend as he holds up a flier with a picture of a middle aged man. "Says here that he's been missing for a week. He was last seen in the Balkan Mountains." Evan stops reading for a second. "Wait, the Balkan Mountains? That place is swarmed with wannabe Yetis."

"Wannabe Yetis?"

"That's what I call them, okay! Anyways, the other job is to exterminate a monster in the Inari village. Which one do you want to do?"
121112211.title: Pick up a job!

12111222.content:
Relying solely on your magical power, you take in a deep breath before releasing a powerful stream of flames towards your foe and engulfing him. The crowd cheers wildly and you watch as the fire soon disperses, leaving a KO'ed Baldy.

You grin victoriously as the viewers scream and yell out your name. However, this match isn't finished.

Suddenly, the earth shakes violently and you turn back to see Evan struggling against the Earth mage. You rush towards them and take your place beside your partner who has a wounded arm.

"He's strong," pants Evan. "Alright, here's the plan: back me up but go for an opening when you see one."

"Okay, four eyes."

"Stop calling me that!"

You snicker and move to the side as a boulder is launch at you. For the next 5 minutes, you watch as Evan and Bushy fight it out, only backing him up when needed. Finally, you see the opening you have been waiting for. Bushy had just blocked Evan's attack and was now open from behind. Not wasting the opportunity, you dash behind him and take in a deep breath once more before--

Your eyes widen as you start to cough violently. Then it hit you - it is because all the dust building up in the air during the fight. Bushy hears you and turns around before commanding a two slabs of rock to rise up from the ground beside you. Then he slams his hands together, causing the two slabs to smash you. Once they pull apart, you fall down to the ground.

Many of your bones have been crushed. After all, there only rules of the tournament were to stay within the arena and to not cause any deaths.

You have lost the match and it will take a while before you can move again. Maybe it wasn't so smart to breathe in all that dust.
12111222.title: Blowing a powerful stream of fire from your mouth

choices: You to drink a cup of my blood
122.content:
“Hm, What’s this? A human child. Judging from his stature I recon he’s probably around the age of 6, 8 at most, and he appears to be lost.”

“…”

“Tell me child, do you seek to avert your fate?”

“…”

“I see. Well seeing that you are lost and shaken for words loss, I can help you find your parents“

“What must I do?”

“If you seek reconciliation with your parents, I need you to trust me.”

“Go on.”

“I require-
122.title: Water Dragon

choices: 1.	After 7 years Aima gives you a Void Dragon Lachrima to consume
7 years later & you're just a plain Water Dragon Slayer
1221.content:
“Very well.”

“You sure you want to go through with this?”

“If it can help me find my way to my parents again, I shall.”

“After all, my life is virtually moot now, so why bother.”

“Very well!”

Draws a ring claw talon

(while piercing you alive with the ring claw talon) “Ti einai paidi onoma sas lene chamenes mnimes. Apantisi emas stin ousia tis Zoios!”

Just when you were about to die, everything became crystal clear again. You told the Water Dragon your name.

“I’m sorry, but your parents are dead.”

“Oh.”

“Seeing that you are so young allow me to be your replacement parent, okay.”

“Alright.”

“By the way my name is Aima.” (Ooh, I can’t wait to rub this in Illdrim’s face! Can’t have Igneel get any close to the lad either)
1221.title: 2 Liters of your blood

choices: 1.	Some mages are attracted to your Dark Guild and join
12211.content:
Aima was more than just a Water Dragon. Aima was also a well seasoned necromancer. Besides caring for you as any other parent would, Aima taught you more than just water magic (It was more like water magic in blood form). You also learned advanced necromancy, how to possess others, and immunity to soul drain. For all your magical prowess however, the only thing you had for yourself when it came to physical hand to hand combat was high dexterity, flexibility, and an uncanny ability to evade almost every single attack. That is to say Aima nurtured your magical abilities, while you mostly just focused on avoiding altercations altogether.
7 years later, Aima said to you
“Son, I have 2 things to say to you.”
“What is it father?"

“1, I won’t be able to care for you any longer and 2, I want you to have this Void Dragon Lachrima. Be sure to remain strong in your morals.”

And so while consuming the Void Dragon Lachrima, you were coroneted as a Water/Void hybrid Dragon Slayer. From the Void element you gain the passive ability to nullify all malign arcane rules and spells (doesn’t include elemental spells such as fireballs, just baleful polymorphs and magical traps and the such) plus you didn’t even need mana for that part. Actually you needed a lack of mana for your Void spells. See, though you were a medical genius, you weren’t much of a fighter. No, instead you were more like a Pure support type only skilled at evasion and self taught in guerrilla warfare. To take care of yourself you formed a dark guild based solely on the principles of true companionship and the power of friendship with your 2 best friends, a female celestial wizard and a non mage alchemist. The Dark Guild was called Faery Tael. Next you and your friends begin supporting whoever could pay you guys the most.

info.brief_description: In a world of magic, you are a Dragon Slayer, one of the most powerful people on Earth.
info.description:
In a world of magic, Dragon Slayers are one of the most powerful beings on Earth. Their name is slightly misleading; they are actually people that have attained the blood of dragons and inherited special powers. You are one of these people. Choose which dragon you have 'slayed', meet new friends, join a guild, take on jobs, and maybe even meet someone special while you're at it.

Land: Illyse
Kingdom: Magnol

1000 galleons = $1

Inspired by: the anime Fairy Tail


Rules:


1. Mild slang curse words like 'dang' and 'heck' are fine, but actual swearing is not allowed.
2. Please use proper grammar. Slang is fine though because it makes the characters sound more real.
3. Violence is fine as long as it's not too much.
4. Romance is allowed and encouraged
5. No explicit scenes please.
6. Please keep it second person point of view.

Other than that, enjoy and add if you'd like!
